TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MotorHat extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Raspberry Pi Motor Hat based on PCA9685 PWM controller

MemberSignature.Value: public MotorHat (System.Device.I2c.I2cConnectionSettings settings, double frequency = 1600);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Device.I2c.I2cConnectionSettings settings, float64 frequency) cil managed
Public Sub New (settings As I2cConnectionSettings, Optional frequency As Double = 1600)
new Iot.Device.MotorHat.MotorHat : System.Device.I2c.I2cConnectionSettings * double -> Iot.Device.MotorHat.MotorHat

Docs.param: The I2C settings of the MotorHat.
The frequency in Hz to set the PWM controller.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified I2C settings and PWM frequency.
Docs.remarks: The default i2c address is 0x60, but the HAT can be configured in hardware to any address from 0x60 to 0x7f. The PWM hardware used by this HAT is a PCA9685. It has a total possible frequency range of 24 to 1526 Hz. Setting the frequency above or below this range will cause PWM hardware to be set at its maximum or minimum setting.

MemberSignature.Value: public MotorHat (double frequency = 1600, int selectedAddress = 0);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64 frequency, int32 selectedAddress) cil managed
Public Sub New (Optional frequency As Double = 1600, Optional selectedAddress As Integer = 0)
new Iot.Device.MotorHat.MotorHat : double * int -> Iot.Device.MotorHat.MotorHat

Docs.param: The frequency in Hz to set the PWM controller.

The I2C settings of the MotorHat. 0 by default if jumpers were not changed Use the following code to set an address equivalent to the one configured in your device jumpers var selectedAddress = 0b000000; // were bits represents jumpers A5 A4 A3 A2 A1 A0
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default I2C address and PWM frequency.
Docs.remarks: The will be created with the default I2C address of 0x60 and PWM frequency of 1600 Hz.

Docs.remarks: The motorNumber parameter refers to the motor numbers M1, M2, M3 or M4 printed in the device.

Docs.summary: Creates a from one of the 4 available PWM channels in the MotorHat
Docs.remarks: The channelNumber refers to ont of the available PWM channel numbers available in the Motor Hat (0, 1, 14, 15) printed in the device.
